oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sparta Rosenwald Colored School

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Educational facilities; Rural schools
Education; Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee; Rosenwald, Julius, 1862-1932
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front and side views of Sparta Rosenwald Colored School. It is a one-story brick structure with five windows on each side of the front entrance. The yard is bare.

Sparta was the only area in White County which received funds through the Julius Rosenwald Fund. According to a report dated June 30, 1922, the total amount of funds expended on this school for building, grounds and equipment was $1,300.
